title: We are all human, yet we categorize ourselves as 'races'. Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: “We are all human, yet we categorize ourselves as "races". Why?” First, I am NOT claiming that one group of humans are ‘better’ than another! With that said, there are different races of human beings broadly classified as; 1. Caucasoid (European) 2. Negroid (African) 3. Mongoloid (Asiatic or Oriental) 4. Indie (Hindu) 5. Australoid (Australian aboriginals) 6. Polynesians/Melanesian/Micronesian (some­times, these three are classified as the Oceanic) 7. American Indian. These groups share many characteristics, yet there are differences that include (but not limited to) skin color, hair, muscular/skeletal structure and DNA. (Major Physical Characteristics of Racial Groups) Races, or racial groups are terms used in categorization of groups of humans. (Race (human categorization) - Wikipedia) Just as we use ‘breed’ to define different groups of other mammals (dogs, cats, horses, cattle, swine, etc.), we use ‘race’ to define different groups of humans. Randy
